decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The works to which this consent relates, must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Method Statement and Structural Report dated 28th September 2015 produced by Knapp Hicks & Partners Ltd received on 15/10/2015. Plan reference BH-PL-01 revision B and Statement on consideration of alternatives received on 14/12/15. Appendix B dated 17/12/2015 produced by Complete Tree Care Ltd and received on 04/01/2016. Arboricultural Report Appendix 3, dated 26/05/2016 produced by Complete Tree Care Ltd and received on 02/06/2016. Arboricultural Report, dated 26/05/2016 produced by Complete Tree Care Ltd and received on 06/06/2016) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 3 - The development hereby approved shall, as far as practically possible, be carried out with the re-use of the original bricks (both whole and part bricks), in accordance with the approved method statement. No alternatives shall be used until approval has been given in writing by the Local Planning Authority of a sample panel of 0.5m2 utilising the new brick. The use of any new brick shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 4 - Prior to its use in the construction of the development hereby approved, it shall be demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority that the lime-mortar will match the existing with regard to composition/mixture and colour (when dried).The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
Condition : 5 - The pointing shall match that of the existing wall.

Condition : 6 - Prior to commencement of the rebuilding stage, plans and elevations at scale 1:20 shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority detailing the junctures of the wall with any other structure including any non-damaged sections of the wall.
description: Listed building consent for demolition and erection of a boundary wall between burlington House and St Mary's church, including the removal of six trees
